summary: Pitaya, also known as dragon fruit, is a cactus fruit native to southern Mexico and Central America. It's now grown in many tropical and subtropical areas worldwide. The fruit has a scaly, leathery skin, which gives it its "dragon" name. Inside, the flesh can be sweet or sour and is usually red, white, or yellow. Pitaya from the genus Stenocereus is commonly called pitaya, while those from Selenicereus are known as pitahaya or dragon fruit.
title: Pitaya
